Key Match Events: Jamie Leweling scored the winning goal for Germany in the 64th minute.
Leweling's initial goal was disallowed for offside, but he made it a case of second time lucky with a close-range finish.
Xavi's thunderous strike hit the crossbar, showcasing his threat.
Pre-Game Insights: German football paid tribute to recently retired international quartet Manuel Neuer, Thomas Müller, Toni Kroos, and İlkay Gündogan before the match.
Julian Nagelsmann's charges dominated early on, with several chances created by Stuttgart players.
Oliver Baumann, aged 34 years and 131 days, became the second oldest player to make his Germany debut in the post-war era.
Post-Match Reflections: Jamie Leweling, 23, scored twice across 17 appearances for Germany's U19s, 20s, and 21s.
Nagelsmann has now won 10 of 17 games as Germany head coach (D4, L3).
Baumann, who made his debut, saved critical moments for Germany, particularly in added time when he dived to block Donyell Malen's shot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Three Stuttgart players featured in consecutive Germany games for the first time since 2009.
Gnabry's 22 goals for Germany make him the highest-scoring current squad member, but his last international goal came in March 2023.
